item.title: Johnston anointed as Mitchell replacement
item.description: South Sydney players have anointed Alex Johnston as the man to replace Latrell Mitchell at fullback, with the star No.1 expected to be sidelined for at least a month.

item.title: Harvey Norman’s business model bears fruit
item.description: Harvey Norman has posted a profit increase of nearly 20 per cent as lockdown measures sparked by COVID-19 fuelled a sales rush for furniture and home goods.

item.title: Video of weapons hoard arrest
item.description: Two people will face court after allegedly attempting to cross the Queensland border with a hoard of weapons and drugs.

item.title: Sydney mega cluster grows
item.description: Another 13 new cases of coronavirus have been recorded in NSW overnight, Premier Gladys Berejiklian confirmed on Friday.

item.title: Tap water warning for 88 suburbs
item.description: Residents in almost 90 Melbourne suburbs have been told not to drink their tap water after a freak storm wreaked havoc across the city on Thursday night.

item.title: ‘Borders putting stress on us all’: PM
item.description: The Prime Minister is pleading with all states and territories to open their borders to avoid further “enormous stress and strain” on regional and cross border communities.

item.title: VIDEO: 50 charged on 360 drug offences
item.description: Police have busted a drug ring in the Logan district after months of investigations, charging 50 people with more than 360 drug and property related offences.

item.title: ‘Heartbreaking’: PM calls for softer borders
item.description: Prime Minister Scott Morrison has told the Queensland Premier she “can’t justify everything on the basis that COVID may break out” after a Ballina mother who could not enter the state lost her unborn baby.

item.title: Teacher charged for texting sex pics
item.description: A teacher at a prestigious school in Sydney’s inner west has been charged with online grooming offences with police alleging he sent lewd images to someone he thought was a teenage girl.

item.title: Boy, 4, killed in freak storm identified
item.description: Three people have died, including a four-year-old boy who had been outside for “two minutes”, after wild weather battered Melbourne on Thursday night.
